intro: Trisyngyne cornuta, commonly known as the horned tristyngyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology. The plant features showy, bisexual flowers with five stamens and a single pistil, typical of the genus Trisyngyne. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Trisyngyne cornuta is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
